intro: Clausia papillosa, commonly known as the silky clausia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its delicate, papillate (bumpy) leaves. The plant produces showy, two-lipped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
